result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony S Kunkel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $2451.53 to be paid as a condition of probation to the following:  $250.00 to Scott H., and $2,201.53 to be paid joint and several to Westridge Builders and American Zurch Company.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with co-defendants or victims listed in the criminal complaint.
No criminal behavior of any type.
Defendant to have a curfew for the first 3 months of probation, must be home from the hours of 10:00 p.m to 6:00 a.m., no exceptions unless approved by Agent.
Follow through with any rules, treatment, and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber, Non-working hours with standard release conditions, STAYED, to be used for Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony S Kunkel in court with attorney Kristin Posekany Fredrick.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #3. Court finds the defendant guilty of count #3.  Counts 1 and 2 are dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Fredrick makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following: count #3.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
90 Days jail without work release (Credit -0 days). 
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any rules, treatment, and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
No contact with co defendants or victims listed in the criminal complaint.
No criminal behavior of any type;
Defendant to have a curfew for the first 3 months of probation, must be home from the hours of 10pm to 6am, no exceptions unless approved by agent.
Condition Time: 10 days Huber, NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
Restitution: $250.00 to be paid to Scott H. as a condition of probation.  $2201.53 to be paid joint and several to Westridge Builders and American Zurich Co as a condition of probation.  
COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
Expunction request is denied.
Defendant Anthony S Kunkel in court with attorney Kristin Posekany Fredrick.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony S Kunkel in court with attorney Kristin Posekany Fredrick.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Fredrick needs additional discovery and offer.  Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Filed with cover letter dated August 28, 2015 from Kristin Fredrick
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Preliminary hearing on August 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to have no contact with co defendants, victim/witness/or residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.
